articles.title: Greetings to Turkish President
articles.content:
Greetings to Turkish President
						
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of greeting to Recep Tayyip Erdogan, president of Turkey, on the occasion of its national day.
					 The message wished the president success in his work for the development of the country.

articles.title: Lao Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
Lao Delegation Leaves
						
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ministry of Public Security of Laos led by Minister Somkeo Sylavong left here for home Thursday.

articles.title: Chinese Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
Chinese Delegation Leaves 
						
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ministry of Civil Affairs of China led by Minister Li Liguo left here for home on Thursday. 
					 During its stay here the members of the delegation visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun to pay tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and mounted the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong to lay a bunch of flowers before the bust of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk standing there and pay silent tribute in her memory. 
					
					 They paid a courtesy call on Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, toured the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum, etc. and laid a wreath before the cemeteries of martyrs of the Chinese People's Volunteers in Anju City and Hoechang County.

articles.title: Iranian Delegation Here
articles.content:
Iranian Delegation Here
						
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Iranian Workers' House led by General Secretary Alireza Mahgoub arrived here Thursday.

articles.title: Foreign Guests Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the German Asia-Pacific Business Association headed by Executive Member Timo Prekop and other foreign guests visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Thursday.
					 The guests paid tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il before their statues at the palace.
					
					 In the halls where the great leaders lie in state the guests paid homage to them.
					
					 They went round the halls in which orders the great leaders received are on display and halls which house cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: Sojourn of German Delegation
articles.content:
Sojourn of German Delegation
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the German Asia-Pacific Business Association headed by Executive Member Timo Prekop visited the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum.
					 The guests made bows to the statue of President Kim Il Sung waving back to the columns of the military parade at the square for celebrating the victory in the war.
					
					 Being briefed on exploits the President performed by winning victory in the war and heroic merits of the Korean army and people who smashed the U.S. imperialists and honorably defended the country, they looked round various halls.
					
					 The delegation also toured e-library and swimming pool of Kim Il Sung University, the Pyongyang Cosmetics Factory and other places.

articles.title: DPRK-Russia Photo and Fine Art Exhibition Opens
articles.content:
DPRK-Russia Photo and Fine Art Exhibition Opens
						
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- A DPRK-Russia photo and fine art exhibition opened in the joint name of the Korean Committee  for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and the Territory Cooperation Center of the Far East Chamber of Commerce and Industry in Russia and the Russian embassy here.
					 On display at the venue of the exhibition were photos dealing with the exploits President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il performed by providing and glorifying the history and tradition of the DPRK-Russia friendship and energetic external activities of Marshal Kim Jong Un who is developing the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries on a new level.
					
					 Also displayed there were photos and fine art pieces on diverse themes showing the achievements made by the Korean people in building a thriving socialist nation, heroic feats performed by soldiers of the Soviet Army during the war against Germany and landscape of the Far East region in Russia.
					
					 An opening ceremony took place at the Grand People's Study House Thursday.
					
					 Present there were officials concerned, working people in the city and the ambassador and staff members of the Russian embassy here.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 The participants looked round the photos and fine art pieces.

articles.title: North-South Workers Football Matches Held
articles.content:
North-South Workers Football Matches Held 
						
Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- There took place football matches of workers in the north and the south for national reconciliation, unity, peace and reunification at May Day Stadium on Thursday. 
					Among the spectators were Kim Yong Dae, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly and chairman of the Central Committee of the Korean Social Democratic Party who doubles as chairman of the National Reconciliation Council; Ju Yong Gil, chairman of the C.C., the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea; Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the C.C., the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League: Ri Myong Gil, chairman of the C.C., the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea: Kim Jong Sun, chairwoman of the C.C., the  Democratic Women's Union of Korea: Kim Wan Su, chairman of the North Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration; Choe Jin Su, chairman of the North Headquarters of the Pan-National Alliance for Korea's Reunification; officials concerned and working people of various circles. 
					
					Also present there were members of the football delegation of south Korean workers for reunification led by Kim Tong Man, chairman of the Federation of Trade Unions of south Korea, and Choe Jong Jin, chief vice-chairman of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions, overseas compatriots and foreigners. 
					
					Ju Yong Gil, Kim Tong Man and Choe Jong Jin said that these matches will mark a great stride forward for the workers in realizing their will for peaceful reunification enshrined in the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, adding that the workers who are playing a locomotive role in the drive for realizing the country's reunification are indeed the eldest son of the fellow countrymen.
					
					The football matches were held between the Capital City Construction team of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea and the joint team of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions and between the Tobacco joint team of GFTUK and the joint team of the Federation of Trade Unions of south Korea. 
					
					The Capital City Construction team and the Tobacco joint team won the matches.

articles.title: National Scientific and Technological Presentations in Fields of Electric Power Industry and Mushroom Production Held
articles.content:
National Scientific and Technological Presentations in Fields of Electric Power Industry and Mushroom Production Held
						
 Phyongsong, October 29 (KCNA) -- National scientific and technological presentations in the fields of electric power industry and mushroom production were separately held in Phyongsong City, South Phyongan Province on Oct. 28 and 29 under the sponsorship of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea.
					 Present there were scientists, technicians, teachers, field officials and three-revolution team members and mushroom cultivators of the relevant fields including Kim Il Sung University, Kim Chaek University of Technology, Wonsan University of Agriculture, units under the State Academy of Sciences, the Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex, the Pukchang Thermal Power Complex, research institutes under the Ministry of Electric Power Industry and mushroom farms.
					
					 The participants heard dozens of valuable papers dealing with the issues of increasing the electric power production and scientific and technological matters arising in putting mushroom production on normal footing.
					
					 The scientific and technological presentation in the field of mushroom production involved lectures on the features of major mushroom species, technology of producing mushrooms by use of substitute materials and scientific and technical issues arising in producing mushrooms in an industrial way.

articles.title: New Stamps Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
New Stamps Issued in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- The DPRK State Stamp Bureau recently issued new stamps dealing with cultural heritages of Korea.
					 The stamps show "Blacksmith's" and "Weaving", typical works created by Kim Hong Do, a famous painter of Korea. As a progressive realistic artist representing the 18th-19th centuries, Kim produced many admirable fine art works.
					
					 The Bureau also brought out stamps showing the banknotes current in the DPRK.

articles.title: New Sanatorium Inaugurated
articles.content:
New Sanatorium Inaugurated
						
 Samchon, October 29 (KCNA) -- The Samchon Kumgang Sanatorium was newly built in South Hwanghae Province.
					 The appearance of the sanatorium in Samchon County which boasts hot spring particularly efficacious for treatment of illness helps people greatly benefit from the socialist health care system.
					
					 An inaugural ceremony took place Thursday.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony its participants looked round the sanatorium.

articles.title: Achievements Made in Traditional Medicine of DPRK
articles.content:
Achievements Made in Traditional Medicine of DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- A WHO Southeast Asia regional workshop on traditional medicine took place here some days ago.
					 At the workshop, Choe Tuk Ryong, director of the Academy of Koryo Medicine in the DPRK, referred to the recent achievements made in Koryo (traditional) medicine of the country.
					
					 According to him, the chart of meridian nerve points was completed to put acupuncture on a more scientific basis and various kinds of efficacious Koryo medicines were developed.
					
					 A signal progress was made in treating ischemic cerebral apoplexy and adiposity through combination of traditional and modern medicines.
					
					 Meanwhile such books on traditional medicine were published, in cooperation with the WHO, as "Koryo Medicine Dictionary", "Koryo Acupuncture Dictionary", "Koryo Clinical Medicine", "Collection of Folk Remedy" and "Clinical Acupuncture and Moxibustion and Manipulation".

articles.title: Song "We'll Travel One Road Forever"
articles.content:
Song "We'll Travel One Road Forever"
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- In a performance for celebrating the 70th birth anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea, the State Merited Chorus put on the stage an orchestral music and male chorus "We'll Travel One Road Forever".
					 The song, created in Juche 70 (1981), makes audience recall with deep emotion the glorious path covered by the DPRK people under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It speaks highly of the faith of the DPRK people to accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche under the guidance of supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The orchestral music and male chorus "We'll Travel One Road Forever" was awarded Kim Jong Il Prize.

articles.title: Feats Made by Great Leaders to Protect National Heritages
articles.content:
Feats Made by Great Leaders to Protect National Heritages
						
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- Today marks the 21st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's visit to the reconstructed Mausoleum of King Tangun. 
					 On this occasion the DPRK people recall the feats President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il performed to glorify the 5 000-year-long history of the Korean nation.
					
					 Under their guidance, the Mausoleum of King Tangun was unearthed and it was ascertained that Tangun was not a mythical being but the ancestral father of the nation, who founded Ancient Korea.
					
					 The unearthing led to have a proper understanding of the first state of Korea.
					
					 Mausoleums of kings Tangun, Tongmyong and Wang Kon were also splendidly reconstructed in the DPRK.
					
					 The long history of the Korean nation is now shining under the guidance of supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Guided by him, the Pyongyang Folklore Park, lively picturing the Korean nation's heritages and customs, was successfully built.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Urges U.S. to Opt for Conclusion of Peace Treaty
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Urges U.S. to Opt for Conclusion of Peace Treaty 
						
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- After the DPRK advanced a crucial proposal for replacing the Korean Armistice Agreement with a peace treaty, world media have a field-day. Many media commented that north Korea called on the U.S. to conclude a peace treaty for peace on the Korean Peninsula. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday observes in a commentary that there is no country which does not bring the issue of peace on the peninsula up for discussion if it is interested in the Asia-Pacific.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 In fact, it is more than once that the situation on the peninsula reached the danger of world nuclear disaster due to military provocations committed in this region, a strategic point in which the interests of world nuclear powers are intertwined and the biggest nuclear arsenal.
					
					 No other area in the world has so dense deployment of huge strategic nuclear forces as south Korea which witnesses provocative saber-rattling including joint military exercises almost everyday.
					
					 It is entirely thanks to the DPRK's nuclear deterrence that peace has been preserved on the peninsula.
					
					 The U.S. has to opt for concluding a peace treaty with the DPRK if it truly hopes for the improvement of relations with the DPRK and peace on the peninsula.
					
					 By origin, the Armistice Agreement was premised on the peaceful settlement of the Korean issue. 
					
					 The replacement of the AA by a peace treaty is a priority issue for peace. This is self-evident. 
					
					 All facts prove that the discussion of the denuclearization of the Korean peninsula is unrealistic and the conclusion of a peace treaty is an urgent task.
					
					 The U.S. should no longer make far-fetched assertions that the denuclearization comes first while rendering the situation on the peninsula tense through ever more undisguised military provocations but make a bold decision to conclude the peace treaty at an early date.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservative Ruling Quarters Denounced for Moving to Control Media
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservative Ruling Quarters Denounced for Moving to Control Media 
						
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- South Korean people of all social standings are strongly opposing the moves of the conservative ruling quarters to control media. 
					 The KBS headquarters of the south Korean Press Trade Union on October 22 made public a statement charging that the meeting of its board of directors took place with the attendance of those recommended by the "Saenuri Party" and only those subservient to power were nominated as candidates for president.
					
					 More than 10 media and civic organizations including the Press Trade Union and the Citizens Federation for Democratic Press held a press conference in Youido, Seoul on October 21. 
					
					 Meanwhile, the director of the Citizens Federation for Democratic Press denounced the moves of "government" and the "Saenuri Party" to put media under control. 
					
					 A caricature writer in his article said the present "government" is more shamelessly and openly trying to tame media organizations and such attempt is bound to fail.

articles.title: South Korean Public Becomes Increasingly Critical of Chief Executive
articles.content:
South Korean Public Becomes Increasingly Critical of Chief Executive 
						
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- South Korean public is becoming increasingly critical of the chief executive for moving to introduce "state-compiled history textbooks", according to the south Korean media.
					 Youth and students conducted a campaign of pasting wall-papers ridiculing the chief executive for tampering with history in Seoul on Oct. 24 under the sponsorship of the Network of Youth and Students for Checking the Introduction of "State-compiled History Textbooks".
					
					 The wall-papers reflected the curse of the people against the present chief executive as she embellished "yusin" dictatorship and justified pro-Japanese and pro-U.S. acts and fascist dictatorship.
					
					 Majority of professors of history in south Korea released statements refusing to write textbooks in protest against the authorities' action. 
					
					 An emeritus professor at Seoul National University in an interview on Oct. 23 said the system of introducing "state-compiled history textbooks" will be the biggest mistake of the present regime.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservative Forces Accused of Distorting History
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservative Forces Accused of Distorting History
						
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- The south Korean conservative forces are working hard to distort history to justify their despicable sycophancy and treachery.
					 The authorities are reportedly editing textbooks in secret after forming a special writing team for facilitating the introduction of "state-compiled history textbooks".
					
					 The Democratic Alliance for New Politics, an opposition party, said that a secret special organization for the introduction was disclosed.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced in Britain
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced in Britain
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- The full text of Marshal Kim Jong Un's work "The Cause of the Great Party of Comrades Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il Is Ever-Victorious" published on the occasion of the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) was posted by the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy on its website on October 24.
					 The work, published on October 4, Juche 104 (2015), clarifies the idea that the seven-decade long history of the WPK is the proud one of victory which demonstrated the validity and invincibility of the cause of the party of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and that the sacred cause of this party is always sure to triumph. 
					
					 The work is illustrated with the photo of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: U.S. and S. Korean Moves for Confrontation with DPRK under Fire by Swiss Organizations
articles.content:
U.S. and S. Korean Moves for Confrontation with DPRK under Fire by Swiss Organizations 
						
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea issued a joint statement on Oct. 23 in denunciation of the U.S. and south Korean moves for confrontation with the DPRK.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The south Korean chief executive made public the so-called "joint statement on the north" with the U.S. president during her recent junket to the U.S.
					
					 She impudently let loose a string of cock-and-bull stories about the "nuclear weapons and human rights issue of the north".
					
					 The U.S. master and his south Korean colonial servant decided to boost "cooperation for coping with the north's provocation," blustering that they "will not recognize the DPRK as a nuclear weapons state".
					
					 They also decided to "further ratchet up the sanctions" against the DPRK.
					
					 Her mean act of begging her U.S. master to further tighten the sanctions against the fellow countrymen in the north is nothing but flattery and submission to the enemies of the DPRK and act of treachery.
					
					 The above-said joint statement issued by the south Korean chief executive and the U.S. president is little short of a declaration of war against the DPRK.
					
					 Through the above-said behavior the U.S. clearly proved that it does not want the conclusion of a peace treaty with the DPRK but seeks only a war.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita Dia Nacional de Turquia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita Dia Nacional de Turquia 
						
Pyongyang, 29 de octubre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 29 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica de Turquia, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, con motivo del Dia Nacional de este pais. 
					El remitente desea al destinatario exitos en su trabajo para el desarrollo del pais.

articles.title: Efectuada competencia de futbol de obreros de Norte y Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Efectuada competencia de futbol de obreros de Norte y Sur de Corea
						
Pyongyang, 29 de octubre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 29 en el Estadio Primero de Mayo la competencia de futbol de obreros del Norte y el Sur de Corea para la reconciliacion, la unidad, la paz y la reunificacion de la nacion.
					La presenciaron el vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema, Kim Yong Dae, presidente del Comite Central del Partido Social-Democrata de Corea y del Consejo de Reconciliacion Nacional; Ju Yong Gil, presidente del CC de la Federacion General de los Sindicatos de Corea (FGSC); Jon Yong Nam, presidente del CC de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung; Ri Myong Gil, presidente del CC de la Union de Trabajadores Agricolas; Kim Jong Sun, presidenta del CC de la Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea; Kim Wan Su, presidente del Comite Norteno por la Ejecucion de la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio; Choe Jin Su, presidente de la direccion nortena de la Alianza Pannacional por la Reunificacion de la Patria y los funcionarios de ramas interesadas, asi como los trabajadores.
					
					Tambien la vieron los miembros de la delegacion de futbol por la reunificacion de obreros del Sur de Corea, encabezada por Kim Tong Man, presidente de la "Federacion de Sindicatos Surcoreanos"(FSS) y Choe Jong Jin, vicepresidente en jefe de la Confederacion de Sindicatos Surcoreanos (CSS), los coreanos en ultramar y los extranjeros.
					
					En sus discursos, Ju Yong Gil, Kim Tong Man y Choe Jong Jin subrayaron que los obreros, que cumplen el papel motor en el logro de la reunificacion, son primer hijo de la nacion coreana. Y agregaron que la presenta cita sera un paso grande de los obreros para materializar la voluntad de la reunificacion pacifica, estipulada en la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y la Declaracion de 4 de Octubre.
					
					Se realizaron los partidos entre la seleccion combinada Tambae de la FGSC y la de FSS y entre el equipo Sudogonsol de la FGSC y el combinado de la CSS.
					
					Los partidos terminaron con las victorias de los equipos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.

articles.title: Presentaciones de ciencias y tecnicas de los dominios de electricidad y de hongos
articles.content:
Presentaciones de ciencias y tecnicas de los dominios de electricidad y de hongos
Phyongsong, 29 de octubre (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 28 y el 29 respectivamente en la ciudad de Phyongsong de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur la presentacion nacional de ciencias y tecnicas de las ramas de la industria electrica y la produccion de hongos bajo el auspicio del Comite Central de la Federacion General de Ciencia y Tecnica de Corea. 
					Asistieron a los eventos los cientificos, tecnicos, profesores, funcionarios en el terreno, miembros de los grupos para las tres revoluciones y cultivadores de hongos de las unidades correspondientes incluyendo la Universidad Kim Il Sung, la Universidad Politecnica Kim Chaek, la Universidad de Agricultura de Wonsan, una unidad adscrita a la Academia Estatal de Ciencias, el Complejo Termoelectrico de Pyongyang, el Complejo Termoelectrico de Pukchang, los institutos adscritos al Ministerio de Industria Electrica y de las fabricas de hongos de todas las localidades del pais.
					
					En las ocasiones fueron presentadas decenas de tesis valiosas para solucionar los problemas cientificos y tecnicos necesarios al aumento de produccion electrica y la normalizacion del cultivo de hongos.
					
					En la presentacion de ciencias y tecnicas de la rama de produccion de hongos, se efectuaron las lecciones sobre las caracteristicas de las principales especies de hongo, las tecnicas de produccion segun las materias primas substitutivas y la produccion industrial de hongos.

articles.title: Emitidos en RPDC nuevos sellos
articles.content:
Emitidos en RPDC nuevos sellos
						
Pyongyang, 29 de octubre (ACNC) -- La Direccion Estatal de Sellos de Corea acabo de emitir nuevos sellos individuales de dos generos alusivos a los patrimonios culturales de Corea.
					Se ven en los sellos las obras del afamado pintor de Corea Kim Hong Do "Herreria" y "Tejedura de canamo".
					
					Kim fue el progresista pintor realista de Corea que representa los siglos XVIII y XIX y dejo las pinturas de figuras humanas inclusive retrato, pinturas de paisaje, grabado y otras obras pictoricas a base de los tipicos metodos de pintura.
					
					Tambien fueron emitidos los sellos alusivos a las monedas que circulan actualmente.
